Overload.descr: string unknown: A string that has an unknown effect on the NPC. May have something to do with Single Player
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/achievements/BalloonPopped Client Tells the client that balloon has popped.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/achievements/Count Client Returns the amount of achievements
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/achievements/EatBall Client Add's one to the count of balls eaten. Once this count reaches 200, the 'Ball Eater' achievement is unlocked.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/achievements/GetCount Client Retrieves progress of given achievement
number achievementID: The ID of achievement to retrieve progress of. Note: IDs start with 0, not 1.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/achievements/GetDesc Client Retrieves description of given achievement
number achievementID: The ID of achievement to retrieve description of. Note: IDs start with 0, not 1.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/achievements/GetGoal Client Retrieves progress goal of given achievement
number achievementID: The ID of achievement to retrieve goal of. Note: IDs start with 0, not 1.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/achievements/GetName Client Retrieves name of given achievement
number achievementID: The ID of achievement to retrieve name of. Note: IDs start with 0, not 1.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/achievements/IncBaddies Client Increases "War Zone" achievement progress by 1.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/achievements/IncBystander Client Increases "Innocent Bystander" achievement progress by 1.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/achievements/IncGoodies Client Increases "Bad Friend" achievement progress by 1.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/achievements/IsAchieved Client Used in GMod 12 in the achievements menu to show the user if they have unlocked certain achievements.
number AchievementID: Internal Achievement ID number
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/achievements/Remover Client Called every time you use the remover tool on something, used by the engine to track achievement progress for 'Destroyer'.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/achievements/SpawnedNPC Client Tracks achievement progress for 'Procreator' - used by the engine internally.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/achievements/SpawnedProp Client Tells the client that a prop has been spawned by the user, used to track achievement progress for 'Creator' by the engine.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/achievements/SpawnedRagdoll Client Tells the client that a ragdoll has been spawned. Used internally to track achievement progress for 'Dollhouse'.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/achievements/SpawnMenuOpen Client An automatically called function that adds one to a count of how many times the spawnmenu has been opened. It's purpose is to help unlock the achievement 'Menu User'.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/ai schedule/EngTask Server Adds an engine task to the schedule.
string _taskname_: Task name.
number _taskdata_: Task data.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/ai schedule/GetTask Server Returns the task at the given index.
number num: Task index.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/ai schedule/New Server Creates a schedule.
string debugname: Debug name.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/ai schedule/NumTasks Server Returns the number of tasks in the schedule.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/ai task/New Server Create a new empty task

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/ai/GetTaskID Server Returns the task Id corresponding to the given task name. {{Deprecated|The function is broken and will return nil!}}
string taskName: The task name to get the ID of
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/Angle/Forward Shared Returns a normal vector facing in the direction that the angle points.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/Angle/IsZero Shared Returns of the pitch, yaw and roll are 0.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/Angle/Normalize Shared Normalizes the angles by applying a module with 360 to pitch, yaw and roll.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/Angle/Right Shared Returns a normal vector facing in the direction that points right relative to the angle's direction.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/Angle/RotateAroundAxis Shared Rotates the angle around the specified axis by the specified degrees.
Vector axis: The axis to rotate around.
number rotation: The degrees to rotate around the specified axis.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/Angle/Set Shared Copies pitch, yaw and roll from the second angle to the first.
Angle originalAngle: The angle to copy the values from.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/Angle/Up Shared Returns a normal vector facing in the direction that points up relative to the angle's direction.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/Angle/Zero Shared Sets pitch, yaw and roll to 0, this function is faster than doing it manually.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/baseclass/Get Shared Gets the base class of an an object. This is used not just by entities, but by widgets, panels, drive modes, entities and weapons. The function DEFINE_BASECLASS translates into a call to this function: in the engine, DEFINE_BASECLASS is replaced with "local BaseClass = baseclass.Get". string name: The base class of the object.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/baseclass/Set Shared Sets the base class of an an object.
string name: The base class of the object.
table tab: The table
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/bf_read/ReadAngle Client Reads an returns an angle object from the bitstream.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/bf_read/ReadBool Client Reads 1 bit an returns a bool representing the bit.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/bf_read/ReadChar Client Reads a signed char and returns a number from -127 to 127 representing the ascii value of that char.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/bf_read/ReadEntity Client Reads a short representing an entity index and returns the matching entity handle.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/bf_read/ReadFloat Client Reads a 4 byte float from the bitstream and returns it.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/bf_read/ReadLong Client Reads a 4 byte long from the bitstream and returns it.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/bf_read/ReadShort Client Reads a 2 byte short from the bitstream and returns it.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/bf_read/ReadString Client Reads a null terminated string from the bitstream.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/bf_read/ReadVector Client Reads a special encoded vector from the bitstream and returns it, this function is not suitable to send normals.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/bf_read/ReadVectorNormal Client Reads a special encoded vector normal from the bitstream and returns it, this function is not suitable to send vectors that represent a position.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/bf_read/Reset Client Rewinds the bitstream so it can be read again.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/bit/arshift Shared Returns the arithmetically shifted value.
number value: The value to be manipulated.
number shiftCount: Amounts of bits to shift.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/bit/band Shared Returns the bitwise and of all values specified.
number value: The value to be manipulated.
number otherValues: Values bit and with. Optional.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/bit/bnot Shared Returns the bitwise not of the value.
number value: The value to be inverted.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/bit/bor Shared Returns the bitwise or of all values specified.
number value: The value to be manipulated.
number otherValues: Values bit or with. Optional

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/bit/bswap Shared Swaps the byte order.
number value: The value to be byte swapped.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/bit/bxor Shared Returns the bitwise xor of all values specified.
number value: The value to be manipulated.
number otherValues: Values bit xor with. Optional.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/bit/lshift Shared Returns the left shifted value.
number value: The value to be manipulated.
number shiftCount: Amounts of bits to shift left by.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/bit/rol Shared Returns the left rotated value.
number value: The value to be manipulated.
number shiftCount: Amounts of bits to rotate left by.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/bit/ror Shared Returns the right rotated value.
number value: The value to be manipulated.
number shiftCount: Amounts of bits to rotate right by.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/bit/rshift Shared Returns the right shifted value.
number value: The value to be manipulated.
number shiftCount: Amounts of bits to shift right by.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/bit/tobit Shared Normalizes the specified value and clamps it in the range of a signed 32bit integer.
number value: The value to be normalized.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/bit/tohex Shared Returns the hexadecimal representation of the number with the specified digits.
number value: The value to be normalized.
number digits: The amount of digits. Optional

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/BotPath/Chase Server If you created your path with type "Chase" this functions should be used in place of [[BotPath/Update]] to cause the bot to chase the specified entity.
NextBot bot: The bot to update along the path
Entity ent: The entity we want to chase

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/BotPath/Compute Server Computes the path
NextBot from: The nextbot we're generating for
Vector to: To point
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/BotPath/Draw Server Draws the path. This is meant for debugging - and uses debug overlay.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/BotPath/GetAge Server Returns the age since the path was built

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/BotPath/GetClosestPosition Server The closest position along the path to a position
Vector position: The point we're querying for
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/BotPath/GetCursorPosition Server Returns the current progress along the path
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/BotPath/GetEnd Server Returns the path end position
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/BotPath/GetLength Server Returns the total length of the path

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/BotPath/GetPositionOnPath Server Returns the vector position of distance along path
number distance: The distance along the path to query
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/BotPath/GetStart Server Returns the path start position
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/BotPath/Invalidate Server Invalidates the current path
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/BotPath/IsValid Server Returns true if the path is valid

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/BotPath/MoveCursor Server Moves the cursor by this much
number distance: The distance to move the cursor (in world units)

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/BotPath/MoveCursorTo Server Sets the cursor position to
number distance: The distance to move the cursor (in world units)
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/BotPath/MoveCursorToEnd Server Moves the cursor to the end of the path
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/BotPath/MoveCursorToStart Server Moves the cursor to the end of the path

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/BotPath/SetGoalTolerance Server How close we can get to the goal to call it done
number distance: The distance we're setting it to

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/BotPath/SetMinLookAhead Server Sets minimum range movement goal must be along path
number distance: The distance we're setting it to

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/BotPath/Update Server Move the bot along the path
NextBot bot: The bot to update along the path

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/cam/ApplyShake Client Shakes the screen at a certain position.
Vector pos: Origin of the shake.
Angle angles: Angles of the shake.
number factor: The shake factor.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/cam/End Client Switches the renderer back to the previous drawing mode from a 2D or 3D context.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/cam/End2D Client Switches the renderer back to the previous drawing mode from a 2D context.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/cam/End3D Client Switches the renderer back to the previous drawing mode from a 3D context.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/cam/End3D2D Client Switches the renderer back to the previous drawing mode from a 3D2D context.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/cam/EndOrthoView Client Switches the renderer back to the previous drawing mode from a 3D orthographic rendering context.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/cam/IgnoreZ Client Tells the renderer to ignore the depth buffer and draw any upcoming operation "ontop" of everything that was drawn yet.
boolean ignoreZ: Determines whenever to ignore the depth buffer or not.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/cam/PopModelMatrix Client Pops the current active rendering matrix from the stack and reinstates the previous one.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/cam/PushModelMatrix Client Pushes the specified matrix onto the render matrix stack.
VMatrix matrix: The matrix to push.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/cam/Start Client Sets up a new rendering context.
RenderCamData dataTbl: Render context config.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/cam/Start2D Client Sets up a new 2D rendering context. This is almost always used with a render target from the render library. To set its position use {{LibraryFunction|render|SetViewPort}} with a target already stored.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/cam/Start3D Client Sets up a new 3D rendering context.
Vector pos: Render cam position.
Angle angles: Render cam angles.
number fov: Field of view. Optional.
number x: X coordinate of where to start the new view port. Optional.
number y: Y coordinate of where to start the new view port. Optional.
number w: Width of the new viewport. Optional.
number h: Height of the new viewport. Optional.
number zNear: Distance to near clipping plane. Optional.
number zFar: Distance to far clipping plane. Optional.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/cam/Start3D2D Client Sets up a new 3D rendering context.
Vector pos: Origin of the 3d2d context(upper left corner).
Angle angles: Angles of the 3d2d context(upper left corner).
number scale: The scale of the render context.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/cam/StartOrthoView Client Sets up a new 3d context using orthographic projection.
number leftOffset: The left plane offset.
number topOffset: The top plane offset.
number rightOffset: The right plane offset. Optional.
number bottomOffset: The bottom plane offset.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CEffectData/GetAngles Shared Gets the angles of the effect.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CEffectData/GetAttachment Shared Returns the attachment id for the effect.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CEffectData/GetColor Shared Gets the byte which represents the color of the effect.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CEffectData/GetDamageType Shared Gets the damage type of the effect using {{Enum|DMG}}.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CEffectData/GetEntIndex Server Returns the entity index of the entity set for the effect.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CEffectData/GetEntity Shared Gets the entity assigned to the effect.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CEffectData/GetFlags Shared Gets the flags of the effect.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CEffectData/GetHitBox Shared Gets the hit box index of the effect.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CEffectData/GetMagnitude Shared Returns the magnitude of the effect.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CEffectData/GetMaterialIndex Shared Returns the material index of the effect.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CEffectData/GetNormal Shared Gets the normal of the effect.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CEffectData/GetOrigin Shared Returns the origin position of the effect.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CEffectData/GetRadius Shared Gets the radius of the effect.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CEffectData/GetScale Shared Gets the scale of the effect.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CEffectData/GetStart Shared Returns the start position of the effect.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CEffectData/GetSurfaceProp Shared Returns the surface property index of the effect.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CEffectData/SetAngles Shared Sets the angle of the effect.
Angle effectAngles: The angle to be set.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CEffectData/SetAttachment Shared Sets the attachment id of the effect to be created with this effect data.
number attachmentID: AttachmentID of the effect.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CEffectData/SetColor Shared Sets the color of the effect.
number color: Color represented by a byte.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CEffectData/SetDamageType Shared Sets the damage type of the effect to be created with this effect data.
number damageType: Damage type, see {{Enum|DMG}}.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CEffectData/SetEntIndex Shared Sets the entity of the effect via its index.
number entIndex: The entity index to be set.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CEffectData/SetEntity Shared Sets the entity of the effect to be created with this effect data.
Entity entity: Entity of the effect, mostly used for parenting.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CEffectData/SetFlags Shared Sets the flags of the effect.
number flags: The flags of the effect.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CEffectData/SetHitBox Shared Sets the hit box index of the effect.
number hitBoxIndex: The hit box index of the effect.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CEffectData/SetMagnitude Shared Sets the magnitude of the effect.
number magnitude: The magnitude of the effect.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CEffectData/SetMaterialIndex Shared Sets the material index of the effect.
number materialIndex: The material index of the effect.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CEffectData/SetNormal Shared Sets the normal of the effect to be created with this effect data.
Vector normal: Normal of the effect.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CEffectData/SetOrigin Shared Sets the origin of the effect to be created with this effect data.
Vector origin: Origin of the effect.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CEffectData/SetRadius Shared Sets the radius of the effect to be created with this effect data.
number radius: Radius of the effect.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CEffectData/SetScale Shared Sets the scale of the effect to be created with this effect data.
number scale: Scale of the effect.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CEffectData/SetStart Shared Sets the start of the effect to be created with this effect data.
Vector start: Start of the effect.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CEffectData/SetSurfaceProp Shared Sets the surface property index of the effect.
number surfaceProperties: The surface property index of the effect.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/chat/AddText Client Adds text to the local player's chat box (which only they can read).
vararg arguments: The arguments. Arguments can be: * {{Type|Color}} - Will set the color for all following strings until the next Color argument. * {{Type|string}} - Text to be added to the chat box. * {{Type|Player}} - Adds the name of the player in the player's team color to the chat box. * {{Type|any}} - Any other type, such as {{Type|Entity}} will be converted to string and added as text.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/chat/GetChatBoxPos Client Returns the chat box positions x and y.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/chat/PlaySound Client Plays the chat "tick" sound.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/cleanup/Add Server Adds an entity to a player's cleanup list.
Player pl: Who's cleanup list to add the entity to.
string type: The type of cleanup.
Entity ent: The entity to add to the player's cleanup list.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/cleanup/CC_AdminCleanup Server An internal function that is called by the "gmod_admin_cleanup" console command. Allows admins to clean up the server
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/cleanup/CC_Cleanup Server An internal function that is called by the "gmod_cleanup" console command. Allows players to cleanup their own props.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/cleanup/GetList Server Gets the cleanup list.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/cleanup/GetTable Shared Gets the table of cleanup types.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/cleanup/Register Shared Registers a new cleanup type.
string type: Name of type.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/cleanup/ReplaceEntity Server Replaces one entity in the cleanup module with another
Entity from: Old entity
Entity to: New entity
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/cleanup/UpdateUI Client Repopulates the clients cleanup menu

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CLuaEmitter/Add Client Creates a new {{Type| CLuaParticle}} with the given material and position.
string material: The particles material.
Vector position: The position to spawn the particle on.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CLuaEmitter/Draw Client Manually renders all particles which parent is the current emitter.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CLuaEmitter/Finish Client Removes the emitter and all its particles.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CLuaEmitter/GetNumActiveParticles Client Returns the amount of active particles of the emitter.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CLuaEmitter/SetBBox Client Usually the bounding box is automatically determined by the particles, this function overrides it.
Vector boxMin: Box minimum.
Vector boxMax: Box maximum.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CLuaEmitter/SetNearClip Client This function sets the the distance between the render cam and the emitter at which the particles should start fading and at which distance fade ends(alpha becomes 0).
number distanceMin: Min distance where the alpha becomes 0.
number distanceMax: Max distance where the alpha starts fading.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CLuaEmitter/SetNoDraw Client If NoDraw is enabled the emitter and all its particles will not be automatically drawn every frame.
boolean noDraw: Do not draw.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CLuaEmitter/SetParticleCullRadius Client The function name has not much in common with its actual function, it applies a radius to every particles that affects the building of the bounding box, as it, usually is constructed by the particle that has the lowest x, y and z and the highest x, y and z, this function just adds/subtracts the radius and inflates the bounding box.
number radius: Particle radius.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CLuaEmitter/SetPos Client Sets the position of the particle emitter.
Vector position: New position.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CLuaParticle/GetAirResistance Client Returns the air resistance of the particle.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CLuaParticle/GetAngles Client Returns the current orientation of the particle.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CLuaParticle/GetAngleVelocity Client Returns the angular velocities for each axis.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CLuaParticle/GetBounce Client Returns the bounciness of the particle.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CLuaParticle/GetColor Client Returns the color of the particle.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CLuaParticle/GetDieTime Client Gets the time in seconds after which the particle will be destroyed.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CLuaParticle/GetEndAlpha Client Gets the alpha value that the particle will reach on its death.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CLuaParticle/GetEndLength Client Gets the length that the particle will reach on its death.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CLuaParticle/GetEndSize Client Gets the size that the particle will reach on its death.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CLuaParticle/GetGravity Client Gets the gravity of the particle.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CLuaParticle/GetLifeTime Client Gets how long in seconds, the particle exists.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CLuaParticle/GetPos Client Gets the absolute position of the particle.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CLuaParticle/GetRoll Client Returns the current rotation of the particle in radians, this should only be used for 2d particles.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CLuaParticle/GetRollDelta Client Returns the current rotation speed of the particle in radians, this should only be used for 2d particles.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CLuaParticle/GetStartAlpha Client Gets the alpha value which the particle has when its created.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CLuaParticle/GetStartLength Client Gets the length which the particle has when its created.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CLuaParticle/GetStartSize Client Gets the size which the particle has when its created.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CLuaParticle/GetVelocity Client Gets the current velocity of the particle.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CLuaParticle/SetAirResistance Client Sets the air resistance of the the particle.
number airResistance: New air resistance.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CLuaParticle/SetAngles Client Sets the angles of the the particle.
Angle ang: New angle.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CLuaParticle/SetAngleVelocity Client Sets the angular velocity of the the particle.
Angle angVel: New angular velocity.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CLuaParticle/SetBounce Client Sets the bounciness of the the particle.
number bounce: New bounciness (between 0 and 1).

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CLuaParticle/SetCollide Client Sets the whenever the particle should collide with the world or not.
boolean doCollide: Should collide.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CLuaParticle/SetCollideCallback Client Sets the function that gets called whenever the particle collides with the world. function collideFunc: Collide callback, the arguments are:

{{FuncArg|CLuaParticle|particle|The particle itself}}
{{FuncArg|Vector|hitPos|Position of the collision}}
{{FuncArg|Vector|hitNormal|Direction of the collision, perpendicular to the hit surface}}

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CLuaParticle/SetColor Client Sets the color of the particle.
number r: The red component.
number g: The green component.
number b: The blue component.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CLuaParticle/SetDieTime Client Sets the time where the particle will be removed.
number dieTime: The new die time.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CLuaParticle/SetEndAlpha Client Sets the alpha of the particle that it will reach when it dies.
number endAlpha: The end alpha value.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CLuaParticle/SetEndLength Client Sets the length of the particle that it will reach when it dies.
number endLength: The end length.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CLuaParticle/SetEndSize Client Sets the size of the particle that it will reach when it dies.
number endSize: The end size.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CLuaParticle/SetGravity Client Sets the directional gravity aka. acceleration of the particle.
Vector gravity: The directional gravity.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CLuaParticle/SetLifeTime Client Sets the time the particles life time.
number lifeTime: The new life time.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CLuaParticle/SetLighting Client Sets whenever particles should be lighted.
boolean useLighting: Use lighting.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CLuaParticle/SetNextThink Client Sets when the particles think function should be called next, this uses the synchronized server time returned by {{GlobalFunction|CurTime}}.
number nextThink: Next think time.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CLuaParticle/SetPos Client Sets the position of the particle.
Vector pos: Particle position.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CLuaParticle/SetRoll Client Sets the roll of the particle in radians. This should only be used for 2d particles.
number roll: Roll in radians.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CLuaParticle/SetRollDelta Client Sets the roll delta of the particle in radians. This should only be used for 2d particles.
number rollDelta: Roll delta in radians.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CLuaParticle/SetStartAlpha Client Sets the initial alpha value of the particle.
number startAlpha: Initial alpha.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CLuaParticle/SetStartLength Client Sets the initial length value of the particle.
number startLength: Initial length.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CLuaParticle/SetStartSize Client Sets the initial size value of the particle.
number startSize: Initial size.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CLuaParticle/SetThinkFunction Client Sets the think function of the particle.
function thinkFunc: Think function.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CLuaParticle/SetVelocity Client Sets the velocity of the particle.
Vector vel: Velocity.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CLuaParticle/SetVelocityScale Client Scales the velocity based on the particle speed.
boolean doScale: Use velocity scaling.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CLuaParticle/VelocityDecay Client Sets whenever particles should be lighted.
boolean useLighting: Use lighting.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CMoveData/AddKey Shared Adds keys to the move data, as if player pressed them.
number keys: Keys to add, see {{Enum|IN}}
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CMoveData/GetAbsMoveAngles Shared Gets the aim angle. Seems to be same as {{ClassFunction|CMoveData|GetAngles}}.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CMoveData/GetAngles Shared Gets the aim angle. On client is the same as {{ClassFunction|Entity|GetAngles}}.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CMoveData/GetButtons Shared Gets which buttons are down
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CMoveData/GetConstraintRadius Shared Returns the radius that constrains the players movement.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CMoveData/GetForwardSpeed Shared Returns the players forward speed.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CMoveData/GetImpulseCommand Shared Gets the number passed to "impute" console command
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CMoveData/GetMaxClientSpeed Shared Returns the maximum client speed of the player
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CMoveData/GetMaxSpeed Shared Returns the maximum speed of the player.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CMoveData/GetMoveAngles Shared Returns the angle the player is moving at. For more info, see {{ClassFunction|CMoveData|SetMoveAngles}}.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CMoveData/GetOldAngles Shared Gets the aim angle. Seems to be same as {{ClassFunction|CMoveData|GetAngles}}.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CMoveData/GetOldButtons Shared Get which buttons were down last frame
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CMoveData/GetOrigin Shared Get the player's position.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CMoveData/GetSideSpeed Shared Returns the strafe speed of the player.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CMoveData/GetUpSpeed Shared Returns the vertical speed of the player. ( Z axis of {{ClassFunction|CMoveData|GetVelocity}} )
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CMoveData/GetVelocity Shared Gets the players velocity.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CMoveData/KeyDown Shared Returns whether the key is down or not
number key: The key to test, see {{Enum|IN}}

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CMoveData/KeyReleased Shared Returns whether the key was released
number key: A key to test, see {{Enum|IN}}

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CMoveData/KeyWasDown Shared Returns whether the key was down or not.

Unlike {{ClassFunction|CMoveData|KeyDown}}, it will return false if {{ClassFunction|CMoveData|KeyPressed}} is true and it will return true if {{ClassFunction|CMoveData|KeyReleased}} is true. number key: The key to test, seee {{Enum|IN}}

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CMoveData/SetAbsMoveAngles Shared Sets absolute move angles.( ? ) Doesn't seem to do anything.
Angle ang: New absolute move angles

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CMoveData/SetAngles Shared Sets angles ( ? ). Doesn't seem to be doing anything.
Angle ang: The angles

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CMoveData/SetButtons Shared Sets the pressed buttons on the move data
number buttons: A number representing which buttons are down, see {{Enum|IN}}

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CMoveData/SetConstraintRadius Shared Sets the radius that constrains the players movement.
It is unknown what this function does as changing its values doesn't affect player movement. number radius: The new constraint radius

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CMoveData/SetForwardSpeed Shared Sets players forward speed.
number speed: New forward speed

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CMoveData/SetImpulseCommand Shared Sets the impulse command. Seems to be broken.
number impulse: The impulse to set

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CMoveData/SetMaxClientSpeed Shared Sets the maximum player speed. Player won't be able to run or sprint faster then this value.
This also automatically sets {{ClassFunction|CMoveData|SetMaxSpeed}}.
This must be called on both client and server to avoid prediction errors.
This will '''not''' reduce speed in air. number maxSpeed: The new maximum speed

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CMoveData/SetMaxSpeed Shared Sets the maximum speed of the player. This must match with {{ClassFunction|CMoveData|SetMaxClientSpeed}} both, on server and client.
Doesn't seem to be doing anything on it's own, use {{ClassFunction|CMoveData|SetMaxClientSpeed}} instead. number maxSpeed: The new maximum speed

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CMoveData/SetMoveAngles Shared Sets the serverside move angles. Means movement keys will act as if player was facing that direction.
Angle dir: The aim direction.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CMoveData/SetOldAngles Shared Sets old aim angles. ( ? ) Doesn't seem to be doing anything.
Angle aimAng: The old angles

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CMoveData/SetOldButtons Shared Sets the 'old' pressed buttons on the move data. These buttons are used to work out which buttons have been released, which have just been pressed and which are being held down.
number buttons: A number representing which buttons were down

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CMoveData/SetOrigin Shared Sets the players position.
Vector pos: The position

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CMoveData/SetSideSpeed Shared Sets players strafe speed.
number speed: Strafe speed

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CMoveData/SetUpSpeed Shared Sets vertical speed of the player. ( Z axis of {{ClassFunction|CMoveData|SetVelocity}} )
number speed: Vertical speed to set

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CMoveData/SetVelocity Shared Sets the player's velocity
table velocity: The velocity to set

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/concommand/Add Shared Creates a console command that runs a function in lua with optional autocompletion function and help text. string name: The command name to be used in console. function commandFunc: The function to run when the concommand is executed.
Args: ( {{FuncArg|Player|ply}}, {{FuncArg|string|cmd}}, {{FuncArg|table|args}}, {{FuncArg|string|fullstring}} ) function autoCompleteFunc: The function to call which should return a table of options for autocompletion. Optional.
Args: ( {{FuncArg|string|cmd}}, {{FuncArg|string|args}} ) string helpText: The text to display should a user run 'help cmdName'. Optional. number flags: Concommand flags from {{Enum|FCVAR}}. Optional.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/concommand/AutoComplete Shared Returns a table for the autocompletion
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/concommand/GetTable Shared Returns a table of all the console commands that were added to the game via lua.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/concommand/Remove Shared Removes a console command.
string name: The command name to be used in console

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/concommand/Run Shared The engine uses this command to run a console command's function that was added with concommand.Add. This function returns true if the console command by name CMD exists, and returns false with an error message if it doesn't.
Player ply: Player to run concommand on
string cmd: Command name
any args: Command arguments. Can be table or string

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/constraint/AddConstraintTable Server Stores info about the constraints on the entity's table.
Entity Ent2: Optional.
Entity Ent3: Optional.
Entity Ent4: Optional.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/constraint/AddConstraintTableNoDelete Server Stores info about the constraints on the entity's table. The only difference between this and {{LibraryFunction|constraint|AddConstraintTable}} is that the constraint does not get deleted when the entity is removed.
Entity Ent2: Optional.
Entity Ent3: Optional.
Entity Ent4: Optional.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/constraint/AdvBallsocket Server Creates an advanced ballsocket (ragdoll) constraint.
Entity Ent1: First entity.
Entity Ent2: Second entity
number Bone1: Bone of first entity (0 for non-ragdolls)
number Bone2: Bone of second entity (0 for non-ragdolls)
number forcelimit: Amount of force until it breaks (0 = unbreakable)
number torquelimit: Amount of torque (rotation speed) until it breaks (0 = unbreakable)
number nocollide: Whether the entities should be no-collided.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/constraint/Axis Server Creates an axis constraint.
Entity Ent1: First entity.
Entity Ent2: Second entity.
number Bone1: Bone of first entity (0 for non-ragdolls)
number Bone2: Bone of second entity (0 for non-ragdolls)
number forcelimit: Amount of force until it breaks (0 = unbreakable)
number torquelimit: Amount of torque (rotation speed) until it breaks (0 = unbreakable)
number nocollide: Whether the entities should be no-collided.
Vector LocalAxis: If you include the LocalAxis then LPos2 will not be used in the final constraint. However, LPos2 is still a required argument.
boolean DontAddTable: Whether or not to add the constraint info on the entity table. See {{LibraryFunction|constraint|AddConstraintTable}}.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/constraint/Ballsocket Server Creates a ballsocket joint. Entity Ent1: First entity Entity Ent2: Second entity number Bone1: Bone of first entity (0 for non-ragdolls) number Bone2: Bone of second entity (0 for non-ragdolls) Vector LocalPos: Centerposition of the joint, relative to the second entity. number forcelimit: Amount of force until it breaks (0 = unbreakable) number torquelimit: Amount of torque (rotation speed) until it breaks (0 = unbreakable) number nocollide: Whether the entities should be nocollided

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/constraint/CanConstrain Server Basic checks to make sure that the specified entity and bone are valid. Returns false if we should not be constraining the entity.
Entity ent: The entity to check
number bone: The bone of the entity to check (use 0 for mono boned ents)
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/constraint/CreateKeyframeRope Server Creates a rope without any constraint

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/constraint/CreateStaticAnchorPoint Server Creates an invisible, non-moveable anchor point in the world to which things can be attached.
Vector pos: The position to spawn the anchor at

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/constraint/Elastic Server Creates an elastic constraint.
Entity Ent1: First entity.
Entity Ent2: Second entity
number Bone1: Bone of first entity (0 for non-ragdolls)
number Bone2: Bone of second entity (0 for non-ragdolls)
Vector LPos1: Position of first end of the rope. Local to Ent1.
Vector LPos2: Position of second end of the rope. Local to Ent2.
string material: The material of the rope.
number width: Width of rope.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/constraint/Find Server Returns the constraint of a specified type between two entities, if it exists
Entity ent1: The first entity to check
Entity ent2: The second entity to check
string type: The constraint type to look for (eg. "Weld", "Elastic", "NoCollide")
number bone1: The bone number for the first entity (0 for monoboned entities)
number bone2: The bone number for the second entity

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/constraint/FindConstraint Server Returns the first constraint of a specific type directly connected to the entity found
Entity ent: The entity to check
string type: The type of constraint (eg. "Weld", "Elastic", "NoCollide")

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/constraint/FindConstraintEntity Server Returns the other entity involved in the first constraint of a specific type directly connected to the entity
Entity ent: The entity to check
string type: The type of constraint (eg. "Weld", "Elastic", "NoCollide")

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/constraint/FindConstraints Server Returns a table of all constraints of a specific type directly connected to the entity
Entity ent: The entity to check
string type: The type of constraint (eg. "Weld", "Elastic", "NoCollide")

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/constraint/ForgetConstraints Server Make this entity forget any constraints it knows about. Note that this will not actually remove the constraints.
Entity ent: The entity that will forget its constraints.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/constraint/GetAllConstrainedEntities Server Returns a table of all entities recursively constrained to an entitiy.
Entity ent: The entity to check
table ResultTable: Table used to return result. Optional.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/constraint/GetTable Server Returns a table of all constraints directly connected to the entity
Entity ent: The entity to check

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/constraint/HasConstraints Server Returns true if the entity has constraints attached to it
Entity ent: The entity to check

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/constraint/Hydraulic Server Creates a Hydraulic constraint.
Player pl: The player that will be used to call {{LibraryFunction|numpad|OnDown}}.
Entity Ent1: First entity.
Entity Ent2: Second entity.
number Bone1: Bone of first entity (0 for non-ragdolls),
number Bone2: Bone of second entity (0 for non-ragdolls).
number width: The width of the rope.
number key: The key binding, corresponding to an {{Enum|KEY}}
number fixed: Whether the hydraulic is fixed.
string material: The material of the rope.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/constraint/Keepupright Server Creates a keep upright constraint.
Entity ent: The entity to keep upright
Angle ang: The angle defined as "upright"
number bone: The bone of the entity to constrain (0 for boneless)

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/constraint/Motor Server Creates a motor constraint.
Entity Ent1: First entity.
Entity Ent2: Second entity.
number Bone1: Bone of first entity (0 for non-ragdolls)
number Bone2: Bone of second entity (0 for non-ragdolls)
number nocollide: Whether the entities should be no-collided.
number toggle: Whether the constraint is on toggle.
Player pl: The player that will be used to call {{LibraryFunction|numpad|OnDown}} and {{LibraryFunction|numpad|OnUp}}.
number forcelimit: Amount of force until it breaks (0 = unbreakable)
number numpadkey_fwd: The key binding for "forward", corresponding to an {{Enum|KEY}}
number numpadkey_bwd: The key binding for "backwards", corresponding to an {{Enum|KEY}}

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/constraint/Muscle Server Creates a muscle constraint.
Player pl: The player that will be used to call {{LibraryFunction|numpad|OnDown}}.
Entity Ent1: First entity.
Entity Ent2: Second entity.
number Bone1: Bone of first entity (0 for non-ragdolls)
number Bone2: Bone of second entity (0 for non-ragdolls)
number width: Width of the rope.
number key: The key binding, corresponding to an {{Enum|KEY}}
number fixed: Whether the constraint is fixed.
string material: Material of the rope.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/constraint/NoCollide Server Creates an no-collide "constraint". Disables collision between two entities.
Entity Ent1: First entity.
Entity Ent2: Second entity.
number Bone1: Bone of first entity (0 for non-ragdolls).
number Bone2: Bone of second entity (0 for non-ragdolls).

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/constraint/Pulley Server Creates a pulley constraint.
number forcelimit: Amount of force until it breaks (0 = unbreakable)
boolean rigid: Whether the constraint is rigid.
number width: Width of the rope.
string material: Material of the rope.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/constraint/RemoveAll Server Attempts to remove all constraints associated with an entity
Entity ent: The entity to check

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/constraint/RemoveConstraints Server Attempts to remove all constraints of a specified type associated with an entity
Entity ent: The entity to check
string type: The constraint type to remove (eg. "Weld", "Elastic", "NoCollide")

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/constraint/Rope Server Creates a rope constraint - with rope!
Entity Ent1: First entity
number Ent2: Second entity
number Bone1: Bone of first entity (0 for non-ragdolls)
number Bone2: Bone of second entity (0 for non-ragdolls)
Vector LPos1: Position of first end of the rope. Local to Ent1.
Vector LPos2: Position of second end of the rope. Local to Ent1.
number length: Length of the rope.
number addlength: Amount to add to the length of the rope. Works as it does in the Rope tool.
number forcelimit: Amount of force until it breaks (0 = unbreakable).
number width: Width of the rope.
string material: Material of the rope.
boolean rigid: Whether the constraint is rigid.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/constraint/Slider Server Creates a slider constraint.
Entity Ent1: First entity.
Entity Ent2: Second entity.
number Bone1: Bone of first entity (0 for non-ragdolls),
number Bone2: Bone of second entity (0 for non-ragdolls).
number width: The width of the rope.
string material: The material of the rope.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/constraint/Weld Server Creates a weld constraint
Entity ent1: The first entity
Entity ent2: The second entity
number bone1: The bonenumber of the first entity (0 for monoboned entities)
number bone2: The bonenumber of the second entity
number forcelimit: The amount of force appliable to the constraint before it will break (0 is never)
boolean nocollide: Should ent1 be nocollided to ent2 via this constraint
boolean deleteent1onbreak: If true, when ent2 is removed, ent1 will also be removed

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/constraint/Winch Server Creates a Winch constraint.
Player pl: The player that will be used to call {{LibraryFunction|numpad|OnDown}} and {{LibraryFunction|numpad|OnUp}}.
Entity Ent1: First entity.
Entity Ent2: Second entity.
number Bone1: Bone of first entity (0 for non-ragdolls),
number Bone2: Bone of second entity (0 for non-ragdolls).
number width: The width of the rope.
number key: The key binding for "forward", corresponding to an {{Enum|KEY}}
number key: The key binding for "backwards", corresponding to an {{Enum|KEY}}
number fwd_speed: Forward speed.
number bwd_speed: Backwards speed.
string material: The material of the rope.
boolean toggle: Whether the winch should be on toggle.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/construct/Magnet Server Creates a magnet.
Player ply: Player that will have the numpad control over the magnet
Vector pos: The position of the magnet
Angle ang: The angles of the magnet
string model: The model of the maget
string material: Material of the magnet ( texture )
number key: The key to toggle the magnet, see {{Enum|KEY}}
number maxObjects: Maximum amount of objects the magnet can hold
number strength: Strength of the magnet
number nopull: If > 0, disallows the magnet to pull objects towards it
number allowrot: If > 0, allows rotation of the objects attached
number startOn: If > 0, enabled from spawn
number toggle: If != 0, pressing the key toggles the magnet, otherwise you'll have to hold the key to keep it enabled
Vector vel: Velocity to set on spawn
Angle aVel: Angular velocity to set on spawn
boolean frozen: Freeze the magnet on start

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/construct/SetPhysProp Server Sets props physical properties.
Player ply: The player. This variable is not used and can be left out.
Entity ent: The entity to apply properties to
number physObjID: You can use this or the argument below. This will be used in case you don't provide argument below.
PhysObj physObj: The physics object to apply the properties to
table data: The table containing properties to apply. See {{Struct|PhysProperties}}
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/controlpanel/Clear Client Clears ALL the control panels ( for tools )

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/controlpanel/Get Client Returns (or creates if not exists) a controlpanel.
string name: The name of the panel.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/ConVar/GetBool Shared Tries to convert the current string value of the convar to a bool, where everything except "1" evaluates to false.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/ConVar/GetDefault Shared Returns the default value of the convar.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/ConVar/GetFloat Shared Attempts to convert the convars value to a float, this only works with numeric values or an empty string(which evaluates to 0).
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/ConVar/GetHelpText Shared Returns the help text assigned to that convar.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/ConVar/GetInt Shared Attempts to convert the convars value to a int, this only works with numeric values or an empty string(which evaluates to 0) and all decimal values are rounded down.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/ConVar/GetName Shared Returns the name of the convar.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/ConVar/GetString Shared Returns the current value as string.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/cookie/Delete Client Clear a cookie on the client.
string name: The name of the cookie that you want to delete.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/cookie/GetNumber Client Sets the value of a cookie on the client.
string name: The name of the cookie that you want to get.
number default: Value to return if the cookie does not exist.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/cookie/GetString Client Sets the value of a cookie on the client.
string name: The name of the cookie that you want to get.
string default: Value to return if the cookie does not exist.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/cookie/Set Client Sets the value of a cookie on the client.
string key: The name of the cookie that you want to set.
string value: Value to store in the cookie.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/coroutine/create Shared Creates a coroutine of the given function.
function func: The function for the coroutine to use

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/coroutine/resume Shared Resumes the given coroutine and passes the given vararg to either the function arguments or the {{LibraryFunction|coroutine|yield}} that is inside that function and returns whatever yield is called with the next time or by the final return in the function.
thread coroutine: Coroutine to resume.
vararg args: Arguments to be returned by {{LibraryFunction|coroutine|yield}}.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/coroutine/running Shared Returns the active coroutine or nil if we are not within a coroutine.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/coroutine/status Shared Returns the status of the coroutine passed to it, the possible statuses are "suspended", "running", and "dead".
thread coroutine: Coroutine to check the status of.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/coroutine/wait Shared Yield's the coroutine for so many seconds before returning. This should only be called in a coroutine. This function uses CurTime() - not RealTime().
number seconds: The number of seconds to wait

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/coroutine/wrap Shared Returns a function which calling is equivalent with calling {{LibraryFunction|coroutine|resume}} with the coroutine and all extra parameters.
function coroutine: Coroutine to resume.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/coroutine/yield Shared Pauses the active coroutine and passes all additional variables to the call of {{LibraryFunction|coroutine|resume}} that resumed the coroutine last time, and returns all additional variables that were passed to the previous call of resume.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CRecipientFilter/AddAllPlayers Server Adds all players to the recipient filter.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CRecipientFilter/AddPlayer Server Adds a player to the recipient filter
Player Player: Player to add to the recipient filter.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CRecipientFilter/AddPVS Server Adds all players that are in the same PVS as this position.
Vector Position: PVS position.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CRecipientFilter/RemoveAllPlayers Server Removes all players from the recipient filter.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CRecipientFilter/RemovePlayer Server Removes the player from the recipient filter.
Player Player: The player that should be in the recipient filter if you call this function.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CRecipientFilter/RemovePVS Server Removes all players that can see this PVS from the recipient filter.
Vector Position: Position that players may be able to see.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CSEnt/Remove Client Removes the clientside entity

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CSoundPatch/ChangePitch Shared Adjust the pitch, alias the speed at which the sound is being played.
number pitch: The pitch can range from 0-255.
number deltaTime: The time to fade from previous to the new pitch.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CSoundPatch/ChangeVolume Shared Adjusts the volume of the sound played.
Appears to only work while the sound is being played. number volume: The volume ranges from 0 to 1. number deltaTime: Time to fade the volume from previous to new value from.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CSoundPatch/FadeOut Shared Fades out the volume of the sound from the current volume to 0 in the given amount of seconds.
number seconds: Fade time.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CSoundPatch/IsPlaying Shared Returns whenever the sound is being played.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CSoundPatch/Play Shared Starts to play the sound.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CSoundPatch/PlayEx Shared Same as {{ClassFunction|CSoundPatch|Play}} but with 2 extra arguments allowing to set volume and pitch directly.
number volume: The volume ranges from 0 to 1.
number pitch: The pitch can range from 0-255.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CSoundPatch/SetSoundLevel Shared Sets the sound level in decibel. number level: The sound level.
See [https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Soundscripts#SoundLevel Valve Dev Wiki] for more info
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CSoundPatch/Stop Shared Stops the sound from being played.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CTakeDamageInfo/AddDamage Shared Increases the damage by damageIncrease.
number damageIncrease: The damage to add.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CTakeDamageInfo/GetAmmoType Shared Returns the ammo type used by the weapon that inflicted the damage.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CTakeDamageInfo/GetAttacker Shared Returns the attacker for example a player that shot the weapon.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CTakeDamageInfo/GetBaseDamage Shared Returns the initial unmodified damage.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CTakeDamageInfo/GetDamage Shared Returns the total damage.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CTakeDamageInfo/GetDamageForce Shared Returns a vector representing the damage force.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CTakeDamageInfo/GetDamagePosition Shared Returns the position where the damage was or is going to be applied to.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CTakeDamageInfo/GetDamageType Shared Returns a bitflag which indicates the damage type(s) of the damage.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CTakeDamageInfo/GetInflictor Shared Returns the inflictor of the This is not necessarily is a weapon.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CTakeDamageInfo/GetMaxDamage Shared Returns the maximum damage.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CTakeDamageInfo/GetReportedPosition Shared Returns the initial, unmodified position where the damage occured.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CTakeDamageInfo/IsBulletDamage Shared Returns true if the damage was caused by a bullet.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CTakeDamageInfo/IsDamageType Shared Returns whenever the damageinfo contains the damage type specified.
number dmgType: {{Enum|DMG}}.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CTakeDamageInfo/IsExplosionDamage Shared Returns whenever the damageinfo contains explosion damage.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CTakeDamageInfo/IsFallDamage Shared Returns whenever the damageinfo contains fall damage.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CTakeDamageInfo/ScaleDamage Shared Scales the damage by the given value.
number scale: Value to scale the damage with.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CTakeDamageInfo/SetAttacker Shared Sets the attacker of the damage for example a player.
Entity ent: The entity to be set as the attacker.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CTakeDamageInfo/SetDamage Shared Sets the amount of damage.
number damage: The value to set the absolute damage to.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CTakeDamageInfo/SetDamageForce Shared Sets the directional force of the damage.
Vector force: The vector to set the force to.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CTakeDamageInfo/SetDamagePosition Shared Sets the position of where the damage gets applied to.
Vector pos: The position to the the damage position to.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CTakeDamageInfo/SetDamageType Shared Sets the damage type.
number type: The damage type, see {{Enum|DMG}}.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CTakeDamageInfo/SetInflictor Shared Sets the inflictor of the damage for example a weapon.
Entity inflictor: The new inflictor.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CTakeDamageInfo/SetMaxDamage Shared Sets the maximum damage the object can cause.
number maxDamage: Maximum damage value.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CTakeDamageInfo/SubtractDamage Shared Subtracts the specified amount from the damage.
number damage: Value to subtract.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CUserCmd/ClearButtons Shared Removes all keys from the command. Doesn't prevent movement, see {{ClassFunction|CUserCmd|ClearMovement}} for this.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CUserCmd/ClearMovement Shared Clears the movement from the command.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CUserCmd/CommandNumber Shared Returns an increasing number representing the index of the user cmd. The value returned is occasionally 0 inside {{HookFunction|GM|CreateMove}}, so it's advised to check for a non-zero value if you wish to get the correct number.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CUserCmd/GetButtons Shared Returns a bitflag indicating which buttons are pressed.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CUserCmd/GetForwardMove Shared The speed the client wishes to move forward with, negative if the clients wants to move backwards.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CUserCmd/GetImpulse Shared Gets the current impulse from the client, usually 0.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CUserCmd/GetMouseWheel Shared Returns the scroll delta as whole number.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CUserCmd/GetMouseX Shared Returns the delta of the angular horizontal mouse movement of the player.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CUserCmd/GetMouseY Shared Returns the delta of the angular vertical mouse movement of the player.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CUserCmd/GetSideMove Shared The speed the client wishes to move sideways with, positive if it wants to move right, negative if it wants to move left.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CUserCmd/GetUpMove Shared The speed the client wishes to move up with, negative if the clients wants to move down.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CUserCmd/GetViewAngles Shared Gets the direction the client wants to move in.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CUserCmd/KeyDown Shared Returns true if the specified button(s) is pressed.
number key: Bitflag representing which button to check, see {{Enum|IN}}.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CUserCmd/RemoveKey Shared Removed a key bit from the current key bitflag.
number button: Bitflag to be removed from the key bitflag, see {{Enum|IN}}.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CUserCmd/SetButtons Shared Sets the buttons bitflag
number buttons: Bitflag representing which buttons are "down", see {{Enum|IN}}.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CUserCmd/SetForwardMove Shared Sets speed the client wishes to move forward with, negative if the clients wants to move backwards.
number speed: The new speed to request.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CUserCmd/SetImpulse Shared Sets the impulse to be send together with the command.
number speed: The impulse to send.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CUserCmd/SetMouseWheel Shared Sets the scroll delta.
number speed: The scroll delta.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CUserCmd/SetMouseX Shared Sets the delta of the angular horizontal mouse movement of the player.
number speed: Angular horizontal move delta.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CUserCmd/SetMouseY Shared Sets the delta of the angular vertical mouse movement of the player.
number speed: Angular vertical move delta.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CUserCmd/SetSideMove Shared Sets speed the client wishes to move sidewards with, positive to move right, negative to move left.
number speed: The new speed to request.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CUserCmd/SetUpMove Shared Sets speed the client wishes to move upwards with, negative to move down.
number speed: The new speed to request.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CUserCmd/SetViewAngles Shared Sets the direction the client wants to move in.
Angle viewAngle: New view angles.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/CUserCmd/TickCount Shared Returns tick count since joining the server. Sometimes returns 0.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/cvars/AddChangeCallback Shared Adds a callback to be called when the named convar changes.
string name: The name of the convar to add the change callback to.
function callback: The function to be called when the convar changes.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/cvars/Bool Shared Retrieves console variable as a boolean.
string cvar: Name of console variable

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/cvars/GetConVarCallbacks Shared Returns a table with the convars callbacks.
string name: The name of the convar.
boolean CreateIfNotFound: If a convar is not found, should it be created.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/cvars/Number Shared Retrieves console variable as a number.
string cvar: Name of console variable

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/cvars/OnConVarChanged Shared Called by the engine when a convar value changes.
'''This is an engine function. Do not call it!''' string name: Convar name string oldVal: The old value of the convar string newVal: The new value of the convar

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/cvars/String Shared Retrieves console variable as a string.
string cvar: Name of console variable

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/debug/debug Shared Enters an interactive mode with the user, running each string that the user enters. Using simple commands and other debug facilities, the user can inspect global and local variables, change their values, evaluate expressions, and so on. A line containing only the word cont finishes this function, so that the caller continues its execution. * Commands for debug.debug are not lexically nested within any function, and so have no direct access to local variables. * This only works on the source dedicated server. * To exit this interactive mode, you can press Ctrl + Z then Enter OR type the word 'cont' on a single line and press enter.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/debug/getfenv Shared Returns the environment of the passed object. This can be set with {{LibraryFunction|debug|setfenv}}
table object: Object to get environment of

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/debug/gethook Shared Returns the current hook settings of the passed thread. The thread argument can be omitted. This is unrelated to gamemode hooks. More information on hooks can be found at http://www.lua.org/pil/23.2.html
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/debug/getregistry Shared Returns the internal Lua registry tables.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/debug/setfenv Shared Sets the environment of the passed object.
table object: Object to set environment of
table env: Environment to set

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/debug/sethook Shared Sets the given function as a Lua hook. This is completely different to gamemode hooks. The thread argument can be completely omitted and calling this function with no arguments will remove the current hook. This is used by default for infinite loop detection. More information on hooks can be found at http://www.lua.org/pil/23.2.html
thread thread: Thread to set the hook on. This argument can be omited
function hook: Function for the hook to call
string mask: The hook's mask
number count: How often to call the hook (in instructions). 0 for every instruction
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/debug/traceback Shared Returns a full execution stack trace.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/debugoverlay/Axis Shared Displays an axis indicator at the specified position.
Vector origin: Position origin
Angle ang: Angle of the axis
number size: Size of the axis
number lifetime: Number of seconds to appear (Defaults to 1)
boolean ignoreZ: If true, will draw on top of everything; ignoring the Z buffer

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/debugoverlay/Box Shared Displays a solid coloured cube at the specified position.
Vector origin: Position origin
Vector mins: Minimum bounds of the cube
Vector maxs: Maximum bounds of the cube
number lifetime: Number of seconds to appear
Color color: Color
boolean ignoreZ: If true, will draw on top of everything; ignoring the Z buffer

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/debugoverlay/BoxAngles Shared Displays a solid colored rotated cube at the specified position.
Vector pos: World position
Vector mins: The mins of the cube ( Lowest corner )
Vector maxs: The maxs of the cube ( Highest corner )
number lifetime: Amount of seconds to show the box
NextBot color: The color of the box
boolean ignoreZ: If true, will draw on top of everything; ignoring the Z buffer

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/debugoverlay/Cross Shared Creates a coloured cross at the specified position for the specified time.
Vector position: Position origin
number size: Size of the cross
number lifetime: Number of seconds the cross to appear
Color color: Color
boolean ignoreZ: If true, will draw on top of everything; ignoring the Z buffer

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/debugoverlay/Line Shared Displays a coloured line at the specified position.
Vector pos1: First position of the line
Vector pos2: Second position of the line
number lifetime: Number of seconds to appear
Color color: Color
boolean ignoreZ: If true, will draw on top of everything; ignoring the Z buffer

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/debugoverlay/Sphere Shared Displays a coloured sphere at the specified position.
Vector origin: Position origin
number size: Size of the sphere
number lifetime: Number of seconds to appear
Color color: Color
boolean ignoreZ: If true, will draw on top of everything; ignoring the Z buffer

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/debugoverlay/Text Shared Displays text at the specified position.
Vector origin: Position origin
string text: String message to display
number lifetime: Number of seconds to appear

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/derma/Color Client Gets the color from a Derma skin of a panel and returns default color if not found
table default: The default color in case of failure.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/derma/DefineControl Client Defines a new Derma control with an optional base
string name: Name of the newly created control
string description: Description of the control
table tab: Table containing control methods and properties
string base: Derma control to base the new control off of

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/derma/DefineSkin Client Defines a new skin so that it is usable by Derma. The default skin can be found in "garrysmod/lua/skins/default.lua"
string name: Name of the skin
string descriptions: Description of the skin
table skin: Table containing skin data
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/derma/GetControlList Client Returns the [[derma/Controls|derma.Controls]] table.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/derma/GetDefaultSkin Client Returns the default skin table, which can be changed with the hook [[GM/ForceDermaSkin]]

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/derma/GetNamedSkin Client Returns the skin table of the skin with the supplied name
string name: Name of skin
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/derma/GetSkinTable Client Returns a copy of the table containing every Derma skin
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/derma/RefreshSkins Client Clears all cache'd panels so that they reassess which skin they should be using

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/derma/SkinHook Client Calls the specified hook for the given panel
string type: The type of hook to run
string name: The name of the hook to run
Panel panel: The panel to call the hook for
number w: The width of the panel
number h: The height of the panel

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/draw/DrawText Client Simple draw text at position, but this will expand newlines and tabs.
string text: Text to be drawn.
string font: Name of font to draw the text in. See [[surface/CreateFont| here]] to create your own font, or hit the link below to get a list of existing fonts.
number x: The X Coordinate.
number y: The Y Coordinate.
number color: Color to draw the text in.
number xAlign: Where to align the text horizontally. Further details can be found [[Enums/TEXT|here]].

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/draw/GetFontHeight Client Returns the height of the specified font in pixels.
string font: Name of the font to get the height of.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/draw/NoTexture Client Sets drawing texture to a default white texture. Useful for resetting the drawing texture.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/draw/RoundedBox Client Draws a rounded box - ideally bordersize will be 8 or 16.
number bordersize: Size of border, should be multiple of 2.
number x: The X Coordinate.
number y: The Y Coordinate.
number width: Width of the box.
number height: Height of the box.
Color color: The Color.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/draw/RoundedBoxEx Client Draws a rounded box. This function also lets you specify which corners are drawn rounded in order of topleft, topright, bottomleft, and bottomright.
number cornerdepth: Depth of rounded corners, should be power of 2.
number x: The X coordinate.
number y: The Y coordinate.
number width: Width of the box.
number height: Height of the box.
Vector color: The color.
boolean topleft: Round top left corner.
boolean topright: Round top right corner.
boolean bottomleft: Round bottom left corner.
boolean bottom right: Round the bottom right corner.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/draw/SimpleText Client Draws text on the screen.
string text: The text to be drawn.
string font: The font.
number x: The x Coordinate.
number y: The y Coordinate.
Color color: The color.
number xAlign: The alignment of the x coordinate using {{Enum|TEXT}}
number yAlign: The alignment of the y coordinate using {{Enum|TEXT}}

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/draw/SimpleTextOutlined Client Creates a simple line of text that is outlined.
string Text: The text to draw.
string font: The font name to draw with. See [[surface/CreateFont| here]] to create your own, or [[Talk:Libraries/surface/SetFont|here]] for a list of existing fonts.
number x: The X Coordinate.
number y: The Y Coordinate.
Color color: The Color.
number xAlign: The Alignment of the X Coordinate.
number yAlign: The Alignment of the Y Coordinate.
number outlinewidth: Width of the outline.
Color outlinecolor: Color of the outline.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/draw/Text Client Works like {{LibraryFunction|draw|SimpleText}} but uses a table structure instead.
table textdata: The text properties. See [[Structures/TextData|TextData]] structure

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/draw/TextShadow Client Works like [[draw/Text| draw.Text]], but draws the text as a shadow.
table textdata: The text properties. See {{Struct|TextData}}
number distance: How far away the shadow appears.
number alpha: How visible the shadow is (0-255).

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/draw/TexturedQuad Client Draws a texture with a table structure.
table texturedata: The texture properties. See {{Struct|TextureData}}

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/draw/WordBox Client Draws a rounded box with text in it - ideally bordersize will be 8 or 16.
number bordersize: Size of border, should be multiple of 2.
number x: The X Coordinate.
number y: The Y Coordinate.
string text: Text to draw.
string font: Font to draw in. See [[surface/CreateFont| here]] to create your own, or hit the link below for a list of existing ones.
Color boxcolor: The box color.
Color textcolor: The text color.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/drive/CreateMove Shared {{Internal}} Clientside, the client creates the cmd (usercommand) from their input device (mouse, keyboard) and then it's sent to the server. Restrict view angles here.
CUserCmd cmd: The user command

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/drive/DestroyMethod Shared {{Internal}} Destroys players current driving method.
Player ply: The player to affect

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/drive/End Shared Player has stopped driving the entity.
Player ply: The player
Entity ent: The entity

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/drive/FinishMove Shared {{Internal}} The move is finished. Copy mv back into the target.
Player ply: The player
CMoveData mv: The move data

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/drive/GetMethod Shared {{Internal}} Returns ( or creates if inexistent ) a driving method.
Player ply: The player

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/drive/Move Shared {{Internal}} The move is executed here.
Player ply: The player
CMoveData mv: The move data

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/drive/PlayerStartDriving Shared Starts driving for the player.
Player ply: The player to affect
Entity ent: The entity to drive
string mode: The driving mode

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/drive/PlayerStopDriving Shared Stops the player from driving anything. ( For example a prop in sandbox )
Player ply: The player to affect

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/drive/Register Shared Registers a new entity drive.
string name: The name of the drive.
table data: The data required to create the drive. This includes the functions used by the drive.
string base: The base of the drive.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/drive/Start Shared Called when the player first starts driving this entity
Player ply: The player
Entity ent: The entity

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/drive/StartMove Shared {{Internal}} The user command is received by the server and then converted into a move. This is also run clientside when in multiplayer, for prediction to work.
Player ply: The player
CMoveData mv: The move data
CUserCmd cmd: The user command

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/duplicator/Allow Shared "Allow this entity to be duplicated"
string classname: An entity's classname

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/duplicator/ApplyBoneModifiers Server "Applies Bone Modifiers"
Player Player: The player whose ragdoll this is
Entity Ent: The ragdoll in question

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/duplicator/ApplyEntityModifiers Server "Applies entity Modifiers"
Player Player: The player whose entity this is
Entity Ent: The entity in question

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/duplicator/ClearEntityModifier Server Clear entity modifiers.
Entity Entity: The entity the modification is stored on
string Type: The name of the stored entity modifier

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/duplicator/Copy Server Creates a duplication.
Entity ent: The entity to duplicate. The function will automatically copy all constrained entities.

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/duplicator/CreateEntityFromTable Server "Create an entity from a table."
This creates an entity using the data in EntTable.
If an entity factory has been registered for the entity's Class, it will be called.
Otherwise, {{LibraryFunction|duplicator|GenericDuplicatorFunction}} will be called instead. Player Player: The player who wants to create something table EntTable: The duplication data to build the entity with

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/duplicator/DoBoneManipulator Server "Restores the bone's data."
Loops through Bones and calls {{ClassFunction|Entity|ManipulateBoneScale}}, {{ClassFunction|Entity|ManipulateBoneAngles}} and {{ClassFunction|Entity|ManipulateBonePosition}} on ent with the table keys and the subtable values s, a and p respectively. Entity ent: The entity to be bone manipulated table Bones: The bone information

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/duplicator/DoFlex Server "Restores the flex data"
Entity Ent: The entity to restore the flexes on
table Flex: The flexes to restore
number Scale: The flex scale to apply. (Flex scale is unchanged if omitted)

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/duplicator/DoGeneric Server "Applies generic every-day entity stuff for ent from table data."
Depending on the values of Model, Angle, Pos, Skin, Flex, Bonemanip, ModelScale and ColGroup in the data table, this calls {{ClassFunction|Entity|SetModel}}, {{ClassFunction|Entity|SetAngles}}, {{ClassFunction|Entity|SetPos}}, {{ClassFunction|Entity|SetSkin}}, {{LibraryFunction|duplicator|DoFlex}}, {{LibraryFunction|duplicator|DoBoneManipulator}}, {{ClassFunction|Entity|SetModelScale}}, {{ClassFunction|Entity|SetCollisionGroup}} on ent.
If ent has a RestoreNetworkVars function, it is called with data.DT. Entity ent: The entity to be applied upon table data: The data to be applied onto the entity

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/duplicator/DoGenericPhysics Server "Applies bone data, generically."
If data contains a PhysicsObjects table, it moves, re-angles and if relevent freezes all specified bones, first converting from local coordinates to world coordinates. Entity Entity: The entity to be applied upon Player Player: The player who owns the entity table data: The data to be applied onto the entity

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/duplicator/FindEntityClass Shared "Returns an entity class factory"
string _name_: The name of the entity class factory

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/duplicator/GenericDuplicatorFunction Server "Generic function for duplicating stuff"
This is called when {{LibraryFunction|duplicator|CreateEntityFromTable}} can't find an entity factory to build with. It calls {{LibraryFunction|duplicator|DoGeneric}} and {{LibraryFunction|duplicator|DoGenericPhysics}} to apply standard duplicator stored things such as the model and position. Player Player: The player who wants to create something table data: The duplication data to build the entity with

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/duplicator/GetAllConstrainedEntitiesAndConstraints Server "Returns all constrained Entities and constraints.
This is kind of in the wrong place. Do not call this from outside of this code. It will probably get moved to constraint.lua soon." Entity ent: The entity to start from table EntTable: The table the entities will be stored in. (Returned by the function) table ConstraintTable: The table the constraints will be stored in (Returned by the function)

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/duplicator/IsAllowed Shared "Returns true if we can copy/paste this entity"
string classname: An entity's classname

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/duplicator/Paste Server "Given entity list and constranit list, create all entities and return their tables"
Calls {{LibraryFunction|duplicator|CreateEntityFromTable}} on each subtable of EntityList. If an entity is actually created, it calls ent:OnDuplicated with the entity's duplicator data, then {{LibraryFunction|duplicator|ApplyEntityModifiers}}, {{LibraryFunction|duplicator|ApplyBoneModifiers}} and ent:PostEntityPaste(Player, ent, CreatedEntities) where CreatedEntities is every entity actually created in this paste session and ent is the entity in question
The constraints are then created with {{LibraryFunction|duplicator|CreateConstraintFromTable}}.
Note: PostEntityPaste is called mid- way through the paste process rather than at the end as one might expect. While all entities have been constructed, not all entities will have had ApplyEntityModifiers applies and no constraints will have been constructed. Player Player: The player who wants to create something table EntityList: A table of duplicator data to create the entities from table ConstraintList: A table of duplicator data to create the constraints from

http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/duplicator/RegisterConstraint Shared Register a function used for creating a duplicated constraint.
string name: The unique name of new constraint
function callback: Function to be called when this constraint is created
any ...: Arguments passed to the callback function
